resources.string: Quick COVID-19 Diagnostic

This application help you checking if you are suspected to have COVID-19. 

 This is not 100% accurate and suspected does not mean confirmed. 

 The questions are based on symptoms of COVID-19 from CDC. 

 Not suspected to have COVID-19 does not mean you are free from Social distance. 

 This program is not responsible for any decision you make from this information. 

 Use this program just as information, make sure to have conversation with your doctor.
Made by - Hyeonwoo Heo, Sukmin Hong
Question 1. Do you have fever or chill?
Question 2. Do you cough often?
Question 3. Are you having difficulty in breathing than usual?
Question 4. Do you get tired easily(Fatigue)?
Question 5. Do you have muscle or body aches?
Question 6. Do you have headache?
Question 7. Are you having loss of taste or smell?
Question 8. Do you have congestion or runny nose?
Question 9. Do you vomit or feel nausea often?
Question 10. Do you have sore throat?
Question 11. Do you have trouble breathing\n(extreme difficulty)?
Question 12. Do you have persistent pain\n or pressure in the chest??
Question 13. Do you feel disoriented and confusing?
Question 14. Are you unable to wake up? or \n Are you unable to sleep?(Happened in 2 weeks)
Question 15. Do you have Bluish lips or face?

You might be infected. 
 You can stay home to see if you get more symptoms. 
 But recommend to Go to near local emergency facility for diagnose test. 
 Before you visit local emergency facility, Make sure to notify that you may have COVID-19
You do not seems like you are infected. \n Stay home and see if you get more symptoms. \n Keep social distance and stay home!
You are suspected to have COVID-19! \n Go to near local emergency facility for diagnose test. \n Before you visit local emergency facility, Make sure to notify that you may have COVID-19
CDC says You need medical care NOW!!! \n Go to local emergency facility!! \n Before you go, Call 911 or local emergency facility, and Nofity that you may have COVID-19.
